\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_ycomp_lem}
Consider the above situation.
Let $\overline  \sU \in \overline{\mathfrak A}$  and let $\overline a\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU}$ be a positive element. If   $\la_0 \in \La$ and $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$.  For any $\eps > 0$ there is $y \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$  and an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline M$ with compact closure such that  
\bean
\left\| y - z\right\|< \eps,\\
w^*\overline a w \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
\eean 
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
For any $\la\in \La$ denote by $a_\la \bydef \desc_{\overline{q}_\la}\left(\overline a \right)$. If in the equation \eqref{blowing_q_eqn} $r_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,0}}= \sqrt{a_{\la_0}}$ for all $j\in \{1,..., n\}$ and $\overline r$ is given by the equation \eqref{blowing_oq_eqn} then
\be\label{blowing_qq_eqn}
\overline r^*\overline r= \left(  \sum_{j = 1}^n \overline r^*_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline r^*_{\overline \a_{j,1}}\right) \overline a \left(  \sum_{j = 1}^n \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline r_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\right)\in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^q}
\ee
Any $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$  can be presented by the sum Let $z = z_0 + c$ where $z_0 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ and $c \in \C$. From  \eqref{blowing_ab_p_eqn} it turns out that $z$ can be regarded as an element of $M\left(A_0\left(\overline \sY\right) \right)$ so one has $z^*\overline a z \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)$. 
For all $\eps > 0$ there is $t_0 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ such that
\be\label{blowing_t_eqn}
\begin{split}
	t_0 = \sum_{j = 1}^n t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}; \quad t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}} \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)_{\sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}}\quad \sU^{\la_0}_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}\in \left\{\sU_{\a_{\la_0}}\right\},\\
	\left\| t_0 - z_0\right\|<\eps,\\
	w \bydef c + t_0 = c+ \sum_{j = 1}^n t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}};\\
	\left\| w - z\right\|<\eps.
\end{split}
\ee
If  $I \subset \left\{1,...,n\right\}$ is such that $j \in I \Leftrightarrow \overline p_\la\left( \overline \sU \right) \cap \sU^\la_{\a^\la_{1,k_j}} \neq \emptyset$ and
$$
r = c + \sum_{j \in I} t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}
$$
then one has 
\be\label{blowing_rar_eqn}
\begin{split}
	r^*\overline a r = w^*\overline a w,\\
	\forall\la\in\La \quad \la \ge\la_0 \quad \Rightarrow \quad r^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)  r = w^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) 
\end{split}
\ee
On the other hand from $j \in I \Leftrightarrow \overline p_\la\left( \overline \sU \right) \cap \sU^\la_{\a^\la_{1,k_j}} \neq \emptyset$ if follows that the sum
$$
r =  \sum_{j\in I} \sqrt{\desc_{\overline p_{\la_0}}\left( \overline a\right)}\left(c+  t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,1}}\cdot ... \cdot t_{\a^{\la_0}_{j,k_j}}\right) 
$$
complies with the construction \ref{blowing_q_empt}, so there is $p_\la$-$\overline\sU$-{extended lift $\mathfrak{ext}$-$\lift_{ \overline{p}_{\la}}^{\overline\sU}\left( r\right)$ of} $r$ (cf. Definition \ref{blowing_q_defn}) given by 
\be\label{blowing_oqt_eqn}
\overline	r= \sqrt{\overline a}\left(  1 +  \sum_{j\in I }  ~\overline t_{\overline \a_{j,0}}\cdot ... \cdot \overline t_{\overline \a_{j,k_j}}\right) \in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^q} .
\ee
where the closure of $\overline\sU^q$ is compact. From the equations \ref{blowing_qq_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_rar_eqn} it follows that 
\bean
w^*\overline a w =\overline	r^*\overline	r \in  A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU^q}.
\eean
Define $\overline\sU^w \bydef \overline\sU^q$.
\end{proof}



\begin{corollary}\label{blowing_spec2_cor}
Let us	consider the above situation, and use the notation \eqref{spec_a_eps_imp_eqn}.
Let $\overline  \sU \in \left\{\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}$  and let $\overline a\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU}$ a positive element,	
If   $\la_0 \in \La$ and $z\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ then following conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item[(i)] The series 
	$$
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2
	$$
	is strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$.
	\item[(ii)] For any $\eps > 0$ there is $w\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ such that for all $\la \ge \la_0$ one has
	\bea\label{blowing_spec21_eqn}
	\left\| y - z\right\|<\eps,\\
	\label{blowing_spec22_eqn}
	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\right\|<\eps,\\
	\label{blowing_spec23_eqn}
	\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow \quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2=
	\left(\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2.
	\eea
\end{enumerate}
\end{corollary}
\begin{proof}
(i)	For all $g\in G_\la$ one has
$$ 
\left(  g\overline a \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le\left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a  \right).
$$
On the other hand $\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a \right) = \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left\| z\right\|^2\left(  g\overline a  \right)^2 = \left\| z\right\|^2\pi_a\left( \desc_{\overline p_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2\right)$,
hence for any finite subset  $G^0_\la\subset G_\la$ one has
$$
\sum_{g\in G^0_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le \left\| z\right\|^2\pi_a\left( \desc_{\overline p_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2\right),
$$
i.e. an increasing series $\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)$ is bounded. 
From the Lemma \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it turns ot that the series 	$\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)$ is strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$. It follows that the series
\bean
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\  \overline a  z\right)^2=\\
= z^* \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)z 
\eean 
is also strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$.\\
(ii) For all $\Delta\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^\sim$ such that $\left\|\Delta\right\|= \delta$ one has
\be\label{blowing_zz_eqn}
\begin{split}
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le \\
	\le\left\| z\right\|^2 \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)  \left(  g\overline a  \right)= \left\| z\right\|^2\desc_{\overline p_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2.\\
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \pi_a \left(z + \Delta \right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\le  \left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right) ^2\desc_{\overline p_\la}\left( \overline a\right)^2,\\
	\left\|\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   z z^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\|\le  \left\| z\right\|^2 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2,\\ 
	\left\|\sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \pi_a \left(z + \Delta \right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\|\le  \left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2
\end{split}
\ee
The series in the equations \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} contain positive summands only and from \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} it turns out that they are bounded.
From the \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it follows that the series in the equations \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} are  strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat \H_a\right)$.
\bean
\left(z + \Delta\right)^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)^*=\\
=
z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)^* +\\
+
\pi_a \left(\Delta\right)^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)^*.
\eean
From the equation \eqref{blowing_zz_eqn} it follows that 
\bean
\left\| 
\pi_a \left(\Delta\right)^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \left(z + \Delta\right)^*\right\|\le\\ \le\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2
\eean
Similarly one has
\bean
\left\| 
z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } \left(  g\overline a  \right)   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^* \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right)  \Delta ^*\right\|\le\\ \le\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2
\eean

One has
$$
\left\|\left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right\|< \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|
$$
If $P\bydef \left|      \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right|\in B\left( \widehat\H_a\right) $  is given by the Proposition \ref{polar_decomposition_prop} then following conditions hold
\begin{itemize}
	\item 
	\bean
	\left\|P\right\|= \left\|\left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right\|  <\delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|
	\eean
	\item \bean\left|\left(  g\overline a  \right)\left(   \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right)\left(  g\overline a  \right)\right|=\\
	=\left(  g\overline a \right)  P\left(  g\overline a  \right).
	\eean
	\item 
	\be\label{blowing_mod_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la} \left(  g\overline a  \right) \left(  \left(z + \Delta\right) \left(z + \Delta\right)^*- z z^*\right) \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\| \le\\
		\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la }\left(  g\overline a  \right) P \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right\| 
		\le \left\| P\right\|\left\|  \sum_{g\in G_\la }\left(  g\overline a  \right)^2 \right\|=\\
		=\left\| P\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2\le \left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2 
	\end{split}
	\ee
\end{itemize} 
If $w \bydef z + \Delta$ then
from the equation \ref{blowing_mod_eqn} it follows that
\bean
\left\|z^* \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la} \left(  g\overline a  \right) \left(  ww^*- z z^*\right) \left(  g\overline a  \right)\right) z\right\| \le\\
\le \left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  \left\| z\right\|^2.
\eean 
From the above equations it follows that
\be
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*  \overline a  w\right)^2-\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*  \overline a  z\right)^2\right\|\le
\phi\left(\delta \right) 
\ee
where $\delta= \left\|w- z\right\|$ and $\phi:\R_+\to \R_+$ is a continuous function given by
\be
\begin{split}
	\phi\left(\delta \right) = \delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 \left\| \overline a\right\|^2+\delta\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  +\\
	+\left( \delta^2+ 2\delta \left\| z\right\|\right)\left\| \overline a\right\|^2  \left\| z\right\|^2=\\
	= \delta\left\| \overline a\right\|^2\left(\left( \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^3 +\left(  \left\| z\right\|+\delta\right)^2 \left\| z\right\|+ \left( \delta+ 2 \left\| z\right\|\right)\ \left\| z\right\|^2\right). 
\end{split}
\ee
Since $\phi\left(0 \right)= 0$ for any $\eps > 0$ there is $\delta_\eps > 0$ such that $\phi\left(\delta_\eps \right) < \eps$.
From the Lemma \ref{blowing_ycomp_lem} it follows that there is  $w \in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)^\sim$ and  an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline M$ with compact closure such that
\bean
\left\| w - z\right\|< \min \left( \eps,\delta_\eps \right) ,\\
w^*\overline aw \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
\eean 
From our above construction it turns out that $w$ satisfies to inequalities  \ref{blowing_spec21_eqn}, \ref{blowing_spec22_eqn}. From the Lemma \ref{top_comp_la_lem} it follows that there is $\mu\in\La$ such that for  any  $\la \ge \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }}$ the set $\overline{   \mathcal U }^w$  is mapped homeomorphically onto  $\overline{p}_\la\left(\overline{   \mathcal U }^w \right)$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it turns out that for all $\la\ge\mu$ following conditions hold
\bean
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)=\desc_{\overline p_\la}\left(w^*\overline a  w \right),\\
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2=\desc_{\overline p_\la}\left(w^*\overline a  w \right)^2,
\eean
hence one has
$$
\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2= \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2
$$
i.e. $w$ satisfies to the equation \ref{blowing_spec23_eqn}.

\end{proof}

\begin{lemma}\label{blowing_spec_lem}
Consider the above situation.
If $\overline  \sU \in \left\{\sU_{\overline\a}\right\}$  and $\overline a\in A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)_{\overline \sU} \subset A_0\left(\overline \sY\right)\subset  B \left( \widehat \H_a\right)$ is a positive element    such that for all $\overline x\in \overline\sX$ the series 
\be
\sum_{g \in G\left(\left.\overline{\sX}~\right|\sX\right) } \rep_{  \overline{x }}\left(g \overline a \right)= \rep_{  \overline{x }}\left( \lift_p \circ \desc_p\left( \overline{a}\right) \right)
\ee
is strongly convergent in $B\left(\H_{\overline x}\right)$ then $\overline a$ is special (cf. Definition \ref{special_element_defn}).
\end{lemma}	
\begin{proof}
Let $\la_0 \in \La$, $\eps > 0$ and  $z \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^{\sim}$. Let us check conditions (a), (b) of the Definition \ref{special_element_defn}.\\
(a) One needs check that
\bea\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp1_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),\\
\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp2_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)   \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),\\
\label{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp3_eqn}
\sum_{g\in G_\la  } \left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)^2    \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right). 
\eea
(cf. Remark \ref{implicit_inc_full_rem}).
\begin{enumerate}
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp1_eqn}. One has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z= z^*\left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\overline a\right) z$. From the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it turns out that there is the strong limit $\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\overline a= \desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$, so one has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$.
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp2_eqn}. From $f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\le z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z$ it follows that $\sum_{g\in G^0_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\le a_\la$ for any finite subset $G^0_\la\subset G_\la$ so from the Lemma  \ref{increasing_convergent_w_lem} it turns out that the series \\$\sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)$ is strongly convergent in $B\left(\widehat\H_a\right)$. Moreover one has
	\be\label{blowing_a0_eqn}
	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } f_\eps\left(z^*\left(  g\overline a\right) z   \right)\right\| \le \left\| a_{\la_0}\right\|.
	\ee 
	From the Lemma \ref{blowing_ycomp_lem} it follows that for all 
	For all  $\delta> 0$ there is $y \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)^{\sim}$ such that $\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta$   and an open subset $\overline\sU^w\subset \overline\sX$ with compact closure such that  
	\bean
	w^*\overline a w \in A_0\left(\overline\sY\right)_{\overline \sU^w}.
	\eean
	If $\delta' > 0$ and select  $\delta $   is  such that 
	$\delta \left( \delta + 2\left\| z\right\|\right) \left\| \overline a\right\|< \delta' $ then
	\be\label{blowing_dp_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad \left\| w^*\overline a w -  z^*\overline a z\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| w-z\right\|< \delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad\left\| y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)y -  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	If $\widehat \H_a^\perp$ is given by
	$$
	\widehat \H_a^\perp \bydef \left\{\left.\xi\in \widehat \H_a\right| \left( y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la_0}}\left( \overline a\right)y\right) \xi=0 \right\}\subset \widehat \H_a,
	$$
	and $p^\perp_y: \widehat \H_a \to \widehat \H_a^\perp$ is the natural projection and $p_y \bydef\left( 1- p^\perp_y\right) $ then there is the following matrix representation
	\bean
	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_yz^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_y & p_yz^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_y^\perp\\
		p_y^\perp z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_y & p_y^\perp z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z p_y^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) y= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_y y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) yp_y & 0\\
		0 & 0
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	z^*\overline a  z= \begin{pmatrix}p_y z^*\overline a  z p_y & p_y z^* \overline a zp_y^\perp\\
		p_y^\perp z^* \overline a zp_y & p_y^\perp z^* \overline a zp_y^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	w^*\overline a  w= 
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_y w^*\overline a  w p_y & 0\\
		0 & 0
	\end{pmatrix},
	\eean 
	hence from the inequality \eqref{blowing_dp_eqn} it turns out that 	$\left\| p_y^\perp z^*\overline a zp_y^\perp\right\|<\delta'$ and
	$\left\| p_y^\perp  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_y^\perp\right\|< \delta'$.  Taking into account that
	\bean
	p_y^\perp f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_y^\perp\le p_y^\perp z^*\overline a zp_y^\perp
	\\
	p_y^\perp f_\eps\left( 	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_y^\perp\le p_y^\perp  z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) zp_y^\perp
	\eean 
	\be\label{blowing_dpp_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| p_y^\perp f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)p_y^\perp\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| p_y^\perp  f_\eps\left( 	z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)p_y^\perp\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the above inequalities and the Lemma \ref{positive_ineq_lem} it follows that
	\be\label{blowing_pos_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-\begin{pmatrix}p_y f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_y & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|},\\
		\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)-\begin{pmatrix}p_y f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_y & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the Corollary \ref{top_comp_la_cor} it follows that there is $\mu \bydef \la_{\overline{   \mathcal U }^y}$ and a continuous map $f_\mu: \sY_\mu \to [0,1]$ such that $f_\mu \left(\overline p_\mu\left( \overline{   \mathcal U }^y\right)  \right) = \{1\}$ and $g\supp f_\mu\cap \supp f_\mu=\emptyset$ for all nontrivial $g\in G\left( \left.{{\sY}}_\mu~\right|\sY\right)$. Otherwise $f_\mu$ is a multiplier of $A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$ for any $\la\ge\mu$ such that $f_\la p_y = p_y f_\la = p_y$.
	It follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_fm_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		p_yf_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right) p_y= p_yf_\mu f_\eps\left(z^*  \overline a z\right) f_\mu p_y,\\
		p_yf_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) p_y= p_yf_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_y,\\
	\end{split}
	\ee
	so one has
	\bean
	f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu
	=\begin{pmatrix}p_y f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right) p_y & p_y f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_y^\perp\\
		p_y^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_y & p_y^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)f_\mu p_y^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu = \\
	=
	\begin{pmatrix}
		p_yf_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)p_y & p_y f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_y^\perp\\
		p_y^\perp f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu p_y & p_y^\perp f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_y^\perp
	\end{pmatrix},\\
	\eean
	From $f_\mu \le 1$ and \eqref{blowing_dpp_eqn} it turns out that 
	\be\label{blowing_dppf_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| p_y^\perp f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)  f_\mu p_y^\perp\right\|<\delta',\\
		\left\| p_y^\perp  f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right) f_\mu p_y^\perp\right\|< \delta'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	On the other hand from $\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)  z\right\|\le \left\| z^*\overline a  z\right\| \le \left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|$,\\  $\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)  z\right\|\le\left\| z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)  z\right\| \le \left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|$, inequalities \eqref{blowing_dpp_eqn} and the Lemma \ref{positive_ineq_lem} it turns out that
	\be\label{blowing_posm_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\|f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu -\begin{pmatrix}p_yf_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu  p_y & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|},\\
		\left\| f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu -\begin{pmatrix}p_yf_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu  p_y & 0\\
			0 & 0
		\end{pmatrix}\right\|<\\
		< \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	The combination of inequalities \eqref{blowing_pos_eqn}  and \eqref{blowing_posm_eqn} yields the following
	\bean
	\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu\right\|< 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right),\\
	\left\|  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)z\right) -f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu\right\|
	< 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right) .
	\eean
	For any  $\eps' > 0$ select $\delta' > 0$ such that $\eps' < 2\left( \delta' + 2\sqrt{\delta'\left\| z\right\|^2\left\|\overline a \right\|}\right)$. Select $\delta > 0$ such that  
	$\delta \left( \delta + 2\left\| z\right\|\right) \left\| \overline a\right\|< \delta' $. From  the above description it follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_a1_eqn}
	\begin{split}
		\left\| z - y\right\|<\delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad\left\| f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)-f_\mu  f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a z\right)f_\mu\right\|< \eps',\\
		\left\| z - y\right\|<\delta \quad\Rightarrow\quad\left\|  f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right)z\right) -f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left( \overline a\right) z\right)f_\mu\right\|
		<\eps'.
	\end{split}
	\ee
	From the inequality \eqref{blowing_a1_eqn}  it follows that 
	\be\label{blowing_ep_eqn}
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \left\|\sum_{	g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right) - \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	 \right\|\le \eps'.
	\ee
	On the other hand from the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_inc_strong_lem} it follows that
	\bean
	\forall \la\ge\mu\quad  \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	= \desc_{\widetilde p_\la}\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right),
	\eean
	so from the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem} it turns out that
	\be\label{blowing_eep_eqn}
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad  \sum_{	g \in G_\la}g\left( f_\mu f_\eps\left( z^* \overline az\right)f_\mu\right) 	 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	\ee
	From the equations \eqref{blowing_ep_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_eep_eqn} it turns out that
	$$
	\forall \eps'> 0\quad \forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \exists a_\la \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right) \quad 	\left\| \sum_{g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right)-a_\la \right\|< \eps',
	$$
	so one has
	$$
	\forall \la\ge\la_0\quad \sum_{g \in G_\la}gf_\eps\left( z^* \overline a z\right)\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right).
	$$
	\item 	 Proof of \eqref{blowing_spec_a_eps_imp3_eqn}.
	From the Corollary \ref{blowing_spec2_cor} it turns out that for any $\eps > 0$ there is $y \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)^+$ which satisfies to the equations \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_spec23_eqn}. It is already proven that for any $\la\ge\la_0$
	$$
	\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)= y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left(\overline a\right)  w\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	$$
	so 
	$$
	\left(\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)= y^*\desc_{\overline p_{\la}}\left(\overline a\right)  y\right)^2\in  A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right).
	$$
	From the equation \eqref{blowing_spec23_eqn} it follows that  
	$$
	\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow \quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right) 
	$$ 
	and taking into account the Lemma \ref{special_element_cut_lem} one has
	\be\label{blowing_2_eqn}
	\forall\la\ge \la_0\quad\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)
	\ee
	Using the equations \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn} and \eqref{blowing_2_eqn} one concludes that 
	$$
	\forall\eps > 0\quad	\forall\la\ge \la_0\quad  \exists b_\la \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)\quad 	\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2 - b_\la\right\|<\eps.
	$$
	Hence one has $\sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( f_\eps\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2 \in A_0\left(\sY_{\la} \right)$.
\end{enumerate}
(b) If $\delta > 0$ is such that $\delta \left(\delta + 2  \left\| y - z\right\|\right)\left\|\overline a\right\| < \delta'$ then from $\left\| y - z\right\|<\delta$ it follows that 
\be
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right) - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right\| < \delta'
\ee
If $\delta'$ is such that $\delta'\left\|\overline a\right\|\left\|\overline z\right\|^2\left(\delta' + 2\left\|\overline a\right\|\left\|\overline z\right\|^2 \right)<\eps/2$ then from  $\left\| y - z\right\|<\delta$ it follows that
\be\label{blowing_e21_eqn}
\left\| \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2  - \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)\right)^2 \right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}.
\ee 
Otherwise from the Corollary \ref{blowing_spec2_cor} there is $w\in A_0\left(\sY_{\la_0} \right)$ such that $\left\| y - z\right\|< \min\left(\eps/2, \delta \right)$ such that  
\be\label{blowing_e22_eqn}
\left\| \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)^2 - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( w^*\overline a  w\right)^2\right\| < \frac{\eps}{2}
\ee
From the equations \eqref{blowing_e21_eqn}, \eqref{blowing_e22_eqn} and taking into account \eqref{blowing_spec22_eqn} it follows that
\be\label{blowing_e23_eqn}
\exists\mu\ge \la_0\quad		\la \ge \mu\quad \Rightarrow 	\left\| \left( \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a  z\right)\right)^2  - \sum_{g\in G_\la } g\left( z^*\overline a z\right)^2\right\|<\eps
\ee
The equation \eqref{blowing_e23_eqn} is version of \eqref{special_set_eqn}.
\end{proof}

\begin{cor}\label{blowing_c0_inc_cor}
Consider the situation of the Lemma \ref{blowing_spec_lem}	
Let
$$
\mathfrak{S}_{A}\bydef\left\{ \pi_{\la}= A_0\left(p_\la \right)  :A  \hookto A_0\left( \mathcal{Y}_\la\right) \right\}_{\la \in \La}
$$
be given by \eqref{blowing_cat_eqn}
be  {pointed finite foliation category} (cf. Definition (ref. \ref{comp_pt_defn}), and let $\overline \sY$ be the disconnected inverse limit \ref{top_topological_inv_lim_defn} 	of a  {pointed topological finite covering category} 
\bean
\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY, x_0\right) }\bydef\\
\bydef \left\{\left\{p_\la:\left( \sY_\la, y^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sY, x_0\right)\right\}_{\la\in\La}, \left\{p^\mu_{ \nu}:\left( \sY_\mu, y^\mu_0\right) \to \left( \sX_\nu, y^\nu_0\right)\right\}_{\substack{\mu,\nu\in\La\\
		\mu\ge\nu}} \right\}
\in \mathfrak{FinTop}^{\text{pt}},
\eean
(cf. Definition \ref{top_sec_p_defn}) and $\overline p: \overline \sY \to \sY$ be the natural covering. Let $A_0\left(\overline \sY \right)$ is given by the equation \eqref{blowing_a0_x_eqn}. 
If 
\be
\begin{split}
	\mathfrak{S}_{\left( A, x_0\right)}	\bydef	\left\{\left\{A_0\left( p_\la\right) : A\hookto A_0\left( \sY_\la\right) \right\}, \left\{A_0\left(p^\mu_\nu\right) :  A_0\left( \sY_\nu\right) \hookto  A_0\left( \sY_\mu\right)\right\}\right\}
\end{split}
\ee
is  a pointed algebraical  finite covering category  (cf. Definition (ref. \ref{comp_pt_defn}) given by the Lemma \ref{blowing_base_point_lem} and $\overline A\in B\left(\H_a\right)$ is its disconnected algebraical infinite noncommutative covering  (cf. Definition \ref{main_defn_full_defn}) then there is the natural inclusion

\chapter{Towards noncommutative homotopy theory}\label{h_gr_chap}
\section{Prototype}
\paragraph{}
Let us construct noncommutative generalization of homotopy groups $\pi_n$ ($n \ge 0)$). It is well known that If $\sX=\coprod_{\iota \in I} \sX_{\iota}$ is disjoint union of connected components then $\pi_0(\sX)\simeq \bigcup_{\iota \in I} \{\sX_{\iota}\}$ and $C(X)\simeq \oplus_{\iota} C(\sX_{\iota})$.
This fact provides evident generalization, i.e if $A = \oplus_{\iota \in I} A_{\iota}$ and $A_{\iota}$ is not a direct sum of algebras $\forall \iota \in I$ then 
\begin{equation}\label{p_0_defn}
\pi_0(A)\simeq \bigcup_{\iota \in I} \{A_{\iota}\} = \bigcup \mathrm{Hom}^0_{\mathbb{C}}(\mathbb{C}, A)
\end{equation}

Generalization of $\pi_n$ can be given as generalization of following formula 
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top}
\pi_{n+m} (\sX, x_0) = \pi_n(\Omega^m(\sX, x_0)),
\end{equation}
where $\Omega^m(X, x_0)$ is the $m$ times iterated loop space (see \ref{topological_loop_spaces}).
Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn} supplies noncommutative generalization of the loop space. So noncommutative homotopy groups can be given as
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top_0}
\pi_{n} (A) = \pi_0(\Omega^n(A)),
\end{equation}
or
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top_1}
\pi_{n} (A) = \pi_1(\Omega^{n - 1}(A)).
\end{equation}
where $\Omega^{n}(A)$ is noncommutative generalization of $n$-times iterated loop space. Formulas  (\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_0}),(\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_1}) mean set theory functions only.
Noncommutative loop space is described in \ref{noncom_loop_space_section}. There are two versions of the noncommutative loop space:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Pointed version $\Omega_0(A)$ (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn}). This version is applicable for pointed $C^*$ algebras only (See definition \ref{pointed_alg_defn}). Pointed version supplies a group structure on
\begin{equation}\nonumber
	\mathrm{Hom}(B, \Omega_0(A)).
\end{equation}
\item Unreduced version of $\Omega(A)$ (cf. Definition \ref{unreduced_noncommutative_loop_defn} below). This version is applicable for any (pro-)$C^*$ - algebra. Unpointed version does not supply a group structure.
\end{enumerate}
If $A = C(\sX)$ then 
\begin{equation}\nonumber
\pi_0(\Omega(A))=\pi_1(\sX)
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}\nonumber
\pi_0(\Omega_0(A))=\pi_1(X)/[\pi_1(X), \pi_1(X)]
\end{equation}
So if $\pi_1(X)$ is an Abelian group, then
\begin{equation}\nonumber
\pi_0(\Omega(A))=\pi_0(\Omega_0(A)).
\end{equation}
Although pointed version supplies a group structure there are a lot of interesting $C^*$ - algebras which do not support the point algebra structure. For example, if  $A_{\theta}$ is a noncommutative torus then a nontrivial homomorphism 
\begin{equation}\nonumber
A_{\theta}\to \mathbb{C}
\end{equation}
does not exist, i.e. noncommutative torus is not a pointed algebra. However there are noncommutative torus $A_{\theta}$ is not a pointed algebra. According to (\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_0}), (\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_1}) we can define $\pi_1(A_{\theta})$ by following two ways
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top_0_nctorus}
\pi_{n} (A_{\theta}) = \pi_0(\Omega_0^n(A_{\theta})),
\end{equation}
or
\begin{equation}\label{higher_homot_gr_top_1_nctorus}
\pi_{n} (A_{\theta}) = \pi_1(\Omega_0^{n - 1}(A_{\theta})).
\end{equation}
Formula (\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_0_nctorus}) does not supply group structure on $\pi_{n} (A_{\theta})$ but formula supplies(\ref{higher_homot_gr_top_1_nctorus} it.

\section{Basic construction}
\paragraph*{}
Let $\left(A, \a\right)$ be a pointed $C^*$-algebra (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_alg_defn}), and let $\left(\Om A, \om_1\right)$ be the pointed loop algebra of $\left(A, \a\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{pointed_noncommutative_loop_defn})
Let $b\left(\Omega A \right)$ be a $C^*$-algebra of all bounded (cf. Definition \ref{pro_bound_defn}) elements of $\Om A$.
Consider the family of \textit{all} $\left\{ \pi_\la:b\left(\Omega A \right) \hookto A_\la\right\}_{\la \in \La}$ (resp. reduced , or free) (cf. Definitions \ref{fin_red_defn} \ref{fin_free_defn}
) noncommutative finite-fold coverings (cf. Definition \ref{fin_defn}). 
Suppose that the family is an {algebraical  finite covering category} (cf. Definition \ref{comp_defn}). If $\sX$ is the spectrum of $b\left(\Omega A \right)$ then the *-homomorphism $\om_1$ correspond to a point $x_0\in\sX$. For all $\la\in \La$ there is the given by the Lemma \ref{cov_spectrum_lem} surjective continuous map $p_\la: \sX_\la \to \sX$ from the spectrum $\sX_\la$ of $A_\la$ to the spectrum of $A$. So for every $\la\in \La$ one can select a point $x^\la_0\in \sX_\la$ such that $p_\la\left( x_0^\la\right) = x_0$. For all $\mu, \nu \in \La$ such that $\mu\le\nu$ we select the unique finite fold noncommutative covering $\pi^\mu_\nu: A_\mu\hookto A_\nu$ such that
\begin{itemize}
\item $\pi^\mu_\nu $ satisfies to the equitation \eqref{fg_ord_eqn},
\item $\pi^\mu_\nu $ corresponds to a pointed  map $\left( \sX_\nu, x^\nu_0\right) \to \left( \sX_\mu, x^\mu_0\right)$. 
\end{itemize}
In result there is   a  {pointed  algebraical  finite covering} category
\be\label{om_p_cat_eqn}
\mathfrak{S}_{\left( b\left(\Omega A \right), \om_1\right) } = \left( \left\{ \pi_\la:b\left(\Omega A \right) \hookto A_\la\right\},\left\{\pi^\mu_\nu: A_\mu\hookto A_\nu\right\} \right)
\ee
Suppose that $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( b\left(\Omega A \right), \a_0\right) }$ is good (cf. Definition \ref{mains_defn}) 

\begin{definition}\label{pi_n_defn}
In the above situation denote by
\be\label{pi_2_eqn}
\pi_2\left(A, \a_0 \right) \bydef \pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right) 
\ee
(cf. Equation \ref{fg_bas_eqn}).
We say that $\pi_2\left(A, \a_0 \right) $ is the second 
) \textit{homotopy group} of $A$,  where $\pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right)$ is the fundamental group (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_eqn}). By the similar way we define   $n^{\text{th}}$ \textit{homotopy group} $\pi_n\left(\sX, x_0 \right)$  of $A$
\be\label{pi_n_eqn}
\pi_n\left(A, \om_{n-1} \right) \bydef \pi_1\left(b\left(\Omega^{n-1} A \right), \left\{\pi^\nu_\mu\right\} \right). 
\ee
Similarly to the Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn} we define the \textit{reduced} and \textit{free} and $n^{\text{th}}$ \textit{homotopy group} (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_eqn}).
%	In both equations \eqref{pi_n_eqn} and \eqref{pi_n_eqn} we assume that $\pi_1$ means the reduced fundamental group (cf. Definition \ref{fg_bas_defn}).


\end{definition}
\section{Homotopy groups of commutative $C^*$-algebras}
\paragraph*{}
Let $\sX$ be a compact, connected, locally path-connected space, and let  $\Omega C\left(\sX\right)$ be the {unreduced noncommutative loop space} of $A$ (cf. Definition \ref{unreduced_noncommutative_loop_defn}). If $\Sigma C\left( S^1\right)$ is the unreduced suspension  of $C\left( S^1\right)$ (cf. Definition \ref{un_sus_defn}) then one has
$$
\Sigma C\left( S^1\right) \cong  C\left( \Sigma S^1\right)\cong C\left(S^2 \right) 
$$
where $\Sigma S^1$ is the unreduced suspension of $S^1$ (cf. Definition \ref{top_sus_defn}).
From the Corollary \ref{nc_s_un_loop_iso_cor} it follows that 
$$
\left[b\left( \Omega C\left(\sX\right)\right) ,C\left( S^1\right) \right]\cong  \left[C\left(\sX \right) , \Sigma C\left(S^1 \right) \right]\cong   \left[C\left(\sX \right) ,  C\left(S^2 \right) \right].
$$
Denote by  $\Omega^{\mathrm{ab}} C\left(\sX\right)$ the abelianization (cf. Defintion \ref{abelianization_defn}) of $\Omega C\left(\sX\right)$ and $\Omega\sX$ the spectrum of $b\left( \Omega^{\mathrm{ab}} C\left(\sX\right)\right) $.
From commutativity of  $C\left( S^1\right)$ it turns out that $\left[b\left( \Omega C\left(\sX\right)\right) ,C\left( S^1\right) \right]\cong \left[b\left( \Omega^{\mathrm{ab}} C\left(\sX\right)\right) ,C\left( S^1\right) \right]\cong\left[ C\left(\Omega\sX\right),C\left( S^1\right) \right]$
(cf. Remark \ref{abelianization_rem}), so one has
$$
\left[ C\left(\Omega\sX\right),C\left( S^1\right) \right]\cong  \left[C\left(\sX \right) , C\left(S^2 \right) \right]
$$
or equivalently
\bea\label{top_p_1_p2]_eqn}
\left[S^1, \Omega\sX\right]\cong  \left[S^2,\sX  \right],\\
\label{top_p_1_p2_eqn}
\pi_1\left( \Omega\sX\right) \cong \pi_2\left( \sX\right) 
\eea
\\
====
\\
Denote by $A \bydef \pi_1\left( \Omega\sX\right)$ and $I \bydef \left[A, A\right]$  the closed ideal $[A, A]$ generated by all commutators $xy-yx$ for $x,y \in  A$, so $A/I$ is the abelianization of $A$ cf Definition \ref{abelianization_defn}. Since $A/I$ is a commutative $C^*$ algebra there is a locally compact Hausdorff space $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ which is a spectrum of $A/I$. If $\sY$ is the spectrum of $A$ then form the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} it follows that there is the following set theoretic disjoint union
\be\label{ho_gr_sp_dec}
\begin{split}
\sY = \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\sqcup \sY^{\mathrm{c}},\\
\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \left(A/I\right)\check{~}; \quad \sY^{\mathrm{c}}\cong\check I
\end{split}
\ee
Any element of $x^{\mathrm{c}} \in \hat A^{\mathrm{c}}$ corresponds  to the primary ideal $I_{x^{\mathrm{c}}}$ of $A$ such that $I_{x^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I \neq I$. It follows that $I_{x^{\mathrm{c}}}/\left( I_{x^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I\right)$ is a not trivial prime ideal  of $A/I$. 


From Propositions  \ref{lift_prop} and \ref{state_prop} any irreducible  representation $ \rep_{x^{\mathrm{c}}} : I \to B\left(\sH_{x^{\mathrm{c}}} \right)$ can be uniquely extended up to  $\rep_{x} : A \to B\left(\sH_{x} \right)$, which induces a representation $\rep_{x^{\mathrm{ab}}}: A/I \to \C$.  The correspondence $x^{\mathrm{c}}\mapsto x^{\mathrm{ab}}$ yields a  map $\phi\hat~: \sY^{\mathrm{c}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$. From $\ker\rep_{\phi\left( x^{\mathrm{c}}\right)\subset }\ker\rep_{x^{\mathrm{c}}}$ it follows that $x^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\phi\hat~\left( x^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$  where both $x^{\mathrm{c}}$ and $\phi\hat~\left( x^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$ are regarded as elements of $\sY$ (cf. equation \ref{ho_gr_sp_dec}). 
If $\check A$ is the prime spectrum of $A$ then form the Theorem \ref{ideal_spectrum_thm} it follows that there is the following set theoretic disjoint union
\be\label{ho_gr_spp_eqn}
\begin{split}
\check A = \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}\sqcup  \check{A}^{\mathrm{c}},\\
\check A^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \left(A/I\right)\check{~}; \quad \check A^{\mathrm{c}}\cong\check I.
\end{split}
\ee
Any element of $\check x^{\mathrm{c}} \in \check A^{\mathrm{c}}$ 
corresponds  to the prime ideal $I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}$ of $A$ such that 
$I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I \neq I$. 
It follows that $I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}/\left( I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I\right)$ is a not trivial prime ideal  of $A/I$. From  \eqref{ho_gr_spp_dec} it follows that $I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}/\left( I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}}}\cap I\right)$ corresponds to a point $\check x^{\mathrm{ab}}\in \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}$. The correspondence $x^{\mathrm{c}}\mapsto x^{\mathrm{ab}}$ yields a  map $\phi\check~: \check A^{\mathrm{c}}\to \check A^{\mathrm{ab}}$.
On the other hand from $I_{\phi\check~\left(\check x^{\mathrm{c}} \right) }\subset I_{\check x^{\mathrm{c}} }$ if follows that  $\check x^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\phi\hat~\left(\check x^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$.
The $C^*$-algebra  $A/I$ is commutative, so $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \check{A}^{\mathrm{ab}}$.
\begin{lemma}
The following conditions hold:
\begin{enumerate}
	\item [(i)] The center of $M\left(A \right)$ is naturally isomorphic to $C_b\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$.
	\item [(ii)] The inclusion $\phi: C_b\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\hookto M\left(A \right)$ is such that $\phi\left(C_0\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\right)\subset A$, i.e. there is the natural inclusion $C_0\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\subset M\left(A \right)$. 
\end{enumerate}
\end{lemma}
\begin{proof}(i) 
From the Theorem \ref{dauns_hofmann_thm} it turns out that $M\left(A \right)$ is naturally isomorphic to the class of bounded continuous  functions on $\check{A}$. If $f$ is a continuous  function on $\check{A}$ then for all $\check x^{\mathrm{c}}\in \check \sY^{\mathrm{c}}$ one has $f\left(\check x^{\mathrm{c}} \right) = f\left( \phi\check~\left(\check x^{\mathrm{c}} \right)\right)$ because $\check x^{\mathrm{c}}$ lies in the closure of $\phi\hat~\left(\check x^{\mathrm{c}}\right)$. It follows that the function $f$ uniquely depends on its restriction $f|_{\check A^{\mathrm{ab}}}= f|_{\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}}$. On the other hand for any  two sided ideal $J\subset C_b\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ the preimage $f^{-1} \left( J\right)$ is a closed ideal if and only if the map $f$ is continuous.\\
(ii) There is a surjective *-homomorphism $A \to A/I$, and taking into account that  $A/I\cong C_0\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ one has a surjective *-homomorphism $\varphi: A \to C_0\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$. For any $f \in \to C_0\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ there is $a \in A$ such that $f = \varphi\left( a\right)$. Otherwise $a = f + a'$ where $a' \in I$, i.e. $f= a -a'$. From $a,a'\in A$ it follows that $f \in A$. 
\end{proof}
From the Exercise \ref{blowing_exer} it turns out that $C\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\hookto A$ is a good Hausdorff blowing-up of $A$ (cf. Definitions \ref{blowing_defn} and \ref{blowing_good_defn}). Taking into account the Lemma \ref{blowing_cov_lem} one has the following lemma.

 If $\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)$ is a free noncommutative finite-fold   covering (cf. Definitions \ref{fin_defn} and \ref{fin_free_defn}) then there is a transitive finite-fold covering $p:\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ such that
 	\bean
	\left(A,\widetilde A, G, \pi \right)\cong \left(A,\widetilde A\left(\widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY_{\mathrm{fin}}^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right) , A_0\left( p\right)  \right).
	\eean
\end{lemma}
From !!! it follows that $\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\cong \Om\sX$ so $\pi_1\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\cong \pi_2\left(\sX \right)$ is an Abelian group. If $\widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\to \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}$ is the universal covering then $G\left( \left. \widetilde\sY^{\mathrm{ab}} \right|\sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)\cong\pi_1\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}\right)$ is residually finite (cf. Definition \ref{residually_finite_defn}). Let us consider a family $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}, y_0  \right) }=\left\{ p_\la: \left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}_\la, y^\la_0\right) \to \left( \sY^{\mathrm{ab}}, y_0\right)\right\}_{\la \in \La} $  of all  transitive finite-fold pointed coverings.
From the Lemma \ref{top_res_fin_lem} it turns out that the pointed space $\left( \widetilde{\sY}^{\mathrm{ab}} , \widetilde{y}_0 \right)$ is the topological inverse noncommutative limit of $\mathfrak{S}_{\left( \sY^{^{\mathrm{ab}}}, y_0 \right) }$  (cf. there is an	algebraical  finite covering category (cf. Definition \ref{comp_defn}) given by

Let us prove that $\pi_1\left( \Omega\sX\right)\cong \pi_1\left(\Om C\left( \sX\right)  \right)$. 


Since the group $\pi_2\left( \sX\right)$ is Abelian both left and right part of the equation \eqref{top_p_1_p2_eqn} do not depend on base point up to the natural isomorphism.
\begin{lemma}
The spectrum of $C^*$-algebra  $b\left( \Omega C\left(\sX\right)\right)$ is naturally homeomorphic to the  Hausdorff  spectrum $\Omega\sX$ of the commutative $C^*$-albebra    $b\left( \Omega^{\mathrm{ab}} C\left(\sX\right)\right)$.

\begin{proof}
If $\sY$ is the spectrum of $b\left( \Omega C\left(\sX\right)\right)$ then any for any $y \in \sY$ there is one dimensional representation
